meanings.definition: A large trunk or stem of a tree.
meanings.sent1: The ancient oak tree had thick boles that provided shade in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The lumberjack chopped down the boles of the pine trees for timber.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel built its nest in the hollow of the boles, thinking it was a cozy home.
meanings.sent4: The boles of knowledge in the library stood tall, waiting to be explored by curious minds.
meanings.sent5: The boles of the giant redwoods reached up to the sky, a testament to nature's grandeur.

meanings.definition: A type of clay used in ceramics.
meanings.sent1: The potter molded the boles into beautiful vases on the pottery wheel.
meanings.sent2: The art class used different colors of boles to create unique pottery pieces.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat left paw prints in the soft boles, creating a mess in the studio.
meanings.sent4: The boles of clay transformed under the skilled hands of the sculptor, becoming works of art.
meanings.sent5: The potter carefully shaped the boles into delicate teacups, each one a masterpiece of craftsmanship.

meanings.sent1: The miners discovered rich boles of gold deep within the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the formation of boles in the rock layers.
meanings.sent3: The sparkling boles in the cave walls caught the explorers' attention, hinting at hidden treasures.
meanings.sent4: The boles of precious gems shimmered in the dim light of the mine, a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The rare boles of crystals found in the cavern were like hidden jewels waiting to be unearthed.
